summary: This is an FBI 302 interview report of a Bureau of Prisons corrections officer conducted on August 29, 2019, regarding his duties and observations in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York. The officer discusses his work schedule, lack of specific suicide prevention training, and his assignment on August 9, 2019, which was a 'shower day' with significant inmate movement.

persons.name: Oravsky Shane W
persons.context: Appears as the drafting agent for the FBI 302 interview report.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as an inmate the corrections officer did not know at the time but became aware of due to the surrounding situation.

events.title: Interview of BOP Corrections Officer
events.description: A Bureau of Prisons corrections officer was interviewed by SDNY AUSAs and OIG/FBI agents regarding his duties and observations in the SHU at MCC New York.

events.title: Officer's Assignment on SHU Shower Day
events.description: The corrections officer worked the 'dry cell' in the SHU from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. It was a 'shower day' involving movement of approximately 70-80 inmates. He was assigned to distribute toiletries.

events.title: Officer Joins BOP
events.description: The corrections officer began his employment with the Bureau of Prisons.

locations: 1 Saint Andrews Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The interviewed corrections officer stated he had received no specific training for the Special Housing Unit (SHU) and never received training on suicide prevention.
The officer worked in the SHU on August 9, 2019, a 'shower day' involving the movement of approximately 70-80 people.
The officer did not know inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the time of his assignment but became aware of him later due to the surrounding situation.
The officer mentioned knowing other individuals referred to as 'G' and 'SHAQ' from past work but could not recall specific instances.
